I'm busy converting JUnit 3 tests to JUnit 4 tests but I've hit a
small sna=
g. The JUnit 3 classes subclassed TestCase, which had a
constructor of 

Te=
stCase(String name)

That "name" variable was, from what I can tell (hey, I=
'm new here),
then obtained within individual tests and in setUp() via Test=
Case's
"getName()" function. 

For example:

class Example extends TestCase=
 {
  public Example(String name) {
    super(name);
    ...
  }

  public t=
estSomething() {
    String name =3D getName();
    assertTrue(name =3D=3D =
"testSomething");
  }
}

In our case, we use the name to access appropriate=
 files on the
filesystem. In JUnit 4, since you don't subclass TestCase, ho=
w do you
access the test's name?
